update.description:
This pull request adds:

- A method to check for looping (self crossing) splines.
- A method to auto adjust tangents to ensure looping never occurs.
update.title: Loop detection for splines

content.raw: Done @caguero.
content.html: Done @caguero.

update.description:
This pull request adds:

- A method to check for looping (self crossing) splines.
- A method to auto adjust tangents to ensure looping never occurs.
update.title: Loop detection for splines

content.raw: Will do.
content.html: Will do.

content.raw: Sure! I wasn't sure if you'd like that sort of syntax.
content.html: Sure! I wasn't sure if you'd like that sort of syntax.

content.raw:
How about this?

`isClosed = this->dataPtr->points[0].MthDerivative(0) ==
                   this->dataPtr->points[numPoints-1].MthDerivative(0);`
content.html:
How about this?

isClosed = this->dataPtr->points[0].MthDerivative(0) == this->dataPtr->points[numPoints-1].MthDerivative(0);

content.raw: Run the static checker again please, a see a few errors after this commit.
content.html: Run the static checker again please, a see a few errors after this commit.

content.raw: Nitpick: Use lower-case for free functions (computeLoopCriticalPoints()).
content.html: Nitpick: Use lower-case for free functions (computeLoopCriticalPoints()).

content.raw: @caguero I did some refactoring, and extended changes for a method to adjust tangents to avoid loops altogether. I think I addressed all your comments. Regarding that TODO for the non-coplanar case, the thing is that the concept of loops when splines go full 3D becomes a bit fuzzy. And so far I haven't found a method to reliably detect loops in such scenarios.
content.html: @caguero I did some refactoring, and extended changes for a method to adjust tangents to avoid loops altogether. I think I addressed all your comments. Regarding that TODO for the non-coplanar case, the thing is that the concept of loops when splines go full 3D becomes a bit fuzzy. And so far I haven't found a method to reliably detect loops in such scenarios.
